lines.text: Nobody in his right mind could ask John Cord to move a herd now.
Nobody but John Cord could move a herd this size - five thousand head full of ringers.
I'm lookin' at this room. It doesn't make me think you're desperate... doesn't make me think movin' five thousand head of cattle is life or death.
Rooms don't change much but bank accounts do.
You know, I ws thinkin' about havin' a drink. Either of you interested?
Interested? Noooo.
The only thing he's interested in is when you're goin' to ask us.
Lots of trials we rode together, Cord. Lots of things I learned from you.
You can forget 'em.

Some things a man doesn't forget, like John Cord's rule for a herd-drinking special - always carry your own keg of whiskey. Let the men break it open in camp to let off some steam. Keeps them from werecking an innocent town.
I don't seem to remember that at the trial.
Nothing to it, Cord. Betwen us we could build the biggest cattle empire this country has ever seen.
I'm not interested in cattle empires, but for the Fort Clemson drive, you got yourself a trail boss.
We've got a trail boss who can feed the herd on burned tumbleweed, water it on dried mud and get us there with more cattle than we had to start with!
Got your rump in two saddles at once, huh? Aren't you spreadin' your influence a little too far?
Keep your herd pointed due East. You should hit Horse Thief Creek in about ten days.
Where are you taking them?
Northeast.
The Dismal River... it's bone dry, isn't it?
No. They'll be able to smell it. It's too thin to plow and too thick to drink.
Those cows will go berzerk.
We'd stick by you till hell froze over and you could skate on it.
Seems like you're always with the cattle.
Seems like they're better than most people to be with.
